body.p: An understanding of prudence is linked to an understanding of the term ‘neutrality’. The Board has identified two aspects of neutrality:

li.p: the neutral application of accounting policies—applying the selected accounting policies in a neutral (ie unbiased) manner (see paragraph BC2.39); and

the selection of neutral accounting policies—selecting accounting policies in order to provide relevant information that faithfully represents the items that it purports to represent (see paragraph BC2.44). A faithful representation requires that the depiction is neutral.

body.p: Financial information is neutral if it is not slanted, weighted, emphasised, de-emphasised or otherwise manipulated to increase the probability that the information will be received favourably or unfavourably by users.
